The Great Wall is a series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials, generally built along an east-to-west line across the historical northern borders of China. The Forbidden City, on the other hand, was the Chinese imperial palace from the Ming dynasty to the end of the Qing dynasty. It is located in the center of Beijing, China, and served as the home of emperors and their households, as well as the ceremonial and political center of Chinese government for almost 500 years.

judge_answer.score_reason: The MLLM output discusses the historical significance of both landmarks in China but misses the precise connection to 'Beijing,' a critical aspect of the standard answer.
